macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Slip as Tech Shares Pull Back Ahead of New Year
items.summary: Wall Street indexes declined on Monday, December 29, 2025: S&P 500 fell 0.35% to 6,905.74, Nasdaq dropped 0.50% to 23,474.34, and Dow lost 0.51% to 48,461.93, driven by weakness in tech stocks like Tesla and Nvidia. Despite the dip, major indexes remain on track for strong monthly and yearly gains amid rotation from tech to value sectors.

items.title: Energy Stocks Rise as Oil Prices Surge 2%
items.summary: Energy sector advanced with oil prices jumping 2.4% to $58.08 for US crude and 2.1% to $61.94 for Brent, boosting Exxon Mobil by 1.2%, while materials slipped on falling precious metals. Bank stocks retreated after a strong 2025 run.

items.title: Federal Reserve Implemented Three Rate Cuts in 2025 Amid Inflation and Slowing Jobs
items.summary: The Fed executed three benchmark interest rate cuts later in the year, contributing to declining Treasury yields, as markets anticipate further reductions in 2025 despite persistent high inflation and a cooling job market.

items.title: S&P 500 Nears 7,000 Mark After Record Weekly Close
items.summary: S&P 500 closed last week at 6,929.94, just 1% shy of 7,000, with Monday's pullback pausing a late-year rally; market shows broadening participation with funds rotating from tech to value sectors like financials and healthcare.

items.title: US500 Index Falls 0.20% to 6,916 on December 29
items.summary: The US500 dipped 0.20% to 6,916 on December 29, 2025, after another 0.18% decline to 6,918, though up 1.52% monthly and 17.08% yearly; Dow opened 0.21% lower led by Nvidia and Goldman Sachs declines.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Slips Below $87,000 as Post-Christmas Rally Fades
items.summary: Bitcoin's brief surge above $90,000 after Christmas has lost momentum, dropping below $87,000 amid normalizing market sentiment from extreme pessimism. Ethereum shows similar consolidation without sustained recovery.

items.title: Bitcoin Forecast Predicts Test of $88,665 Resistance Followed by Decline to $78,505
items.summary: Analysts forecast Bitcoin attempting a bullish correction to test resistance near $88,665 before rebounding downward toward $78,505, within a short-term bearish trend and descending channel.

items.title: XRP, Solana, and Dogecoin Outperform Bitcoin with Gains Over 1%
items.summary: XRP rose 1.1%, Solana and Dogecoin gained 1.3% in the past 24 hours, beating Bitcoin's consolidation between $86,500-$90,000, boosted by XRP ETF inflows exceeding $1.25 billion.

items.title: Bitcoin Whales Accumulate in $80,000 Range While Smaller Holders Sell
items.summary: Large Bitcoin holders (whales) have been the primary accumulators around the $80,000 price level, contrasting with selling from smaller investors amid ongoing market consolidation.

items.title: Analysts Warn of 30% Drop for Coinbase Stock Amid Crypto Slump
items.summary: Needham & Company lowered price targets on Coinbase (COIN), trading at $238 pre-market, with mixed ratings from Deutsche Bank ($340 buy) and Goldman Sachs ($294 neutral) as crypto markets correct.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI's GPT-5 Designs Science Experiments 79x Faster
items.summary: OpenAI's GPT-5 model demonstrated remarkable problem-solving by autonomously designing gene copying experiments, achieving 79 times faster results for Red Queen Bio. This highlights advancements in agentic AI for scientific research.

items.title: Google Releases Gemini 3 and Gemini 3 Flash Models
items.summary: Google launched Gemini 3 and Gemini 3 Flash in late 2025, capable of tasks like code writing and weather prediction; AlphaFold has now aided over 3 million researchers worldwide.

items.title: SoftBank Acquires DigitalBridge for $4B to Boost AI Infrastructure
items.summary: SoftBank announced a $4 billion acquisition of DigitalBridge to enhance AI infrastructure capabilities, supporting its $500 billion Project Stargate for hyperscale data centers.

items.title: Top AI Security Threats Emerge in 2025 Including Malware in Models
items.summary: Security researchers identified key threats like malware in Hugging Face AI models, LLMjacking via stolen credentials, and prompt injections, urging better vetting and defenses.

items.title: Geoffrey Hinton Discusses AI Learning and Future Risks
items.summary: Nobel laureate Geoffrey Hinton explained that AI learns like biological neurons via simulated neural nets and warned of risks, countering views that machine learning is purely deliberative.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: ECARX Announces $23 Million Strategic Investment in Lotus Technology
items.summary: ECARX Holdings Inc. announced a US$23 million investment in Lotus Technology on December 29, 2025, to deepen their global partnership in automotive technology.[8]

items.title: Dubai Sports Council Launches World Sports Summit
items.summary: The Dubai Sports Council announced the World Sports Summit on December 29–30, 2025, to discuss the future of the sports sector, highlighting ongoing sports tech developments.[3]

items.title: World Table Tennis Extends Media Rights Partnership with Dyn Until 2027
items.summary: World Table Tennis extended its media rights partnership with German OTT sports streaming platform Dyn until 2027, demonstrating long-term commitment to platform extensions.[3]
